snippet: The United States and Iran are being drawn together by their mutual opposition to a movement of Sunni fighters raising Al Qaeda’s flag in Syria, Lebanon, Iraq, Afghanistan and Yemen.
abstract: United States and Iran, while they pursue negotiations on Tehran's nuclear program, are being drawn together by their mutual opposition to a movement of Sunni fighters raising Al Qaeda’s flag in Syria, Lebanon, Iraq, Afghanistan and Yemen; Iran offers to join US in sending military aid to Shiite government in Baghdad.
lead_paragraph: The United States and Iran are being drawn together by their mutual opposition to a movement of Sunni fighters raising Al Qaeda’s flag in Syria, Lebanon, Iraq, Afghanistan and Yemen.

headline.main: U.S. and Iran Face Common Enemies in Mideast Strife
headline.print_headline: U.S. and Iran Face Common Enemies in Mideast Strife
